actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

actions.subcommittee: Intellectual Property, Competition and the Internet
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Intellectual Property, Competition and the Internet.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Intellectual Property, Competition and the Internet

official_title: To restore the rule that agreements between manufacturers and retailers, distributors, or wholesalers to set the price below which the manufacturer's product or service may not be sold violates the Sherman Act.
short_title: Discount Pricing Consumer Protection Act of 2011

summary.text: Discount Pricing Consumer Protection Act of 2011 - Provides that any agreement setting a price below which a product or service may not be sold by a retailer, wholesaler, or distributor violates the Sherman Act.

titles.title: Discount Pricing Consumer Protection Act of 2011

To restore the rule that agreements between manufacturers and retailers, distributors, or wholesalers to set the price below which the manufacturer's product or service may not be sold violates the Sherman Act.
